message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a protocol for maintaining and updating a linear ordering of transactions in a cryptocurrency system, which is a core component of virtually every cryptocurrency system. The protocol is developed based on the well-established field of Asynchronous Byzantine Fault Tolerant (ABFT) systems, which suggests that the paper could belong to cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) or cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also focuses on improving the efficiency and latency of the protocol, which could suggest that it belongs to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) or cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Finally, the paper aims to prove the correctness, efficiency, and security of the protocol, which could suggest that it belongs to cs.SY (Systems and Control). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.NI, and cs.SY, in that order.
